I took a look at your account and this isn't your first encounter with the Instant Feedback System. You've received 2 chat restrictions, a 14 day ban and then the permanent ban. 

Unfortunately you should have reformed your behaviour before now.

Having a look at your chat logs, you're consistently verbally abusing your team mates and this is something the community actively rejects. 

To be clear your permanent ban will not be reversed.

Too be clear, I have contacted the ACCC ( The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission). I wonder how they are going to deal with this.

It is marked down as product safety due to the fact I have exceeded a particular amount in wealth in product which I am not able too use anymore. It states that I am entited to a complete refund. League of legends terms and agreements are not above Australian law. I will continue to pursue this.
**You do not own your account.** The ACCC will do nothing for you. You are not entitled to a refund. Riot is within their rights.

No, you don't. The account is owned by Riot and is on loan to you (the player) for *personal* use. This is stated in **both** the [Terms Of Use](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) and [End User License Agreement](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/eula).

Here's exactly what it says in the EULA (**Section IV. Ownership**):

> You further acknowledge and agree that you shall have no ownership or other property interest in your Account, and you acknowledge and agree that all rights in and to the Account are and shall forever be owned by and inure to the benefit of Riot Games.

Here's exactly what is says is the TOU (**Section IV. Ownership B. Game Assets, Riot Points and Virtual Items.**):

> NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY HEREIN, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU SHALL HAVE NO OWNERSHIP OR OTHER PROPERTY INTEREST IN YOUR ACCOUNT, AND YOU FURTHER ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT ALL RIGHTS IN AND TO THE ACCOUNT ARE AND SHALL FOREVER BE OWNED BY AND INURE TO THE BENEFIT OF RIOT GAMES.  YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU HAVE NO CLAIM, RIGHT, TITLE, OWNERSHIP OR OTHER PROPRIETARY INTEREST IN THE GAME ASSETS, VIRTUAL ITEMS OR RIOT POINTS THAT YOU ACQUIRE, REGARDLESS OF THE CONSIDERATION OFFERED OR PAID IN EXCHANGE FOR RIOT POINTS OR VIRTUAL ITEMS.  FURTHERMORE, RIOT GAMES SHALL NOT BE LIABLE, TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN ANY MANNER FOR THE DESTRUCTION, DELETION, MODIFICATION, IMPAIRMENT, “HACKING,” OR ANY OTHER DAMAGE OR LOSS OF ANY KIND CAUSED TO THE GAME ASSETS, VIRTUAL ITEMS OR RIOT POINTS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE DELETION OF GAME ASSETS, VIRTUAL ITEMS OR RIOT POINTS UPON THE TERMINATION OR EXPIRATION OF YOUR ACCOUNT.
*Note: This is in all caps in the actual TOU agreement, all I did was copy-past this paragraph (to ensure accuracy) and can't be bothered to change all of it manually.*
Why do you say that now that they're being harsher you'll agree to being "nicer" Pls. Just disappear from the community, you clearly do not enjoy the game
I didn't know that I would get permanently banned just after a 14 day ban. That time lapse is quite short. What if I were to make a deal, too improve my behavior dramatically?
Unfortunately no, the ban will not be lifted on your account.

Hey Summoner,

Retaliation is almost never a reasonable reaction to other toxic players. The player you are retaliating against probably *wants* to see you get upset. When you get into an argument you are just creating new problems for the other players, and the trolls will just egg you on even more. The best thing to do is just mute them and report their behavior.

Riot doesn't do infinitely stacking (permanent) chat restrictions anymore. The players that get them almost always used their limited chat to continue harassing people, or moved their abuse to griefing through gameplay. It simply wasn't effective for player reform. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/cIfEodbz/d/45xUUKxk?comment=000400000001

Punishment also has 4 tiers, and are typically administered in order;

* 10 game chat restriction
* 25 game chat restriction
* 14 day account ban
* Permanent account ban

Except in extreme cases such as hate speech and death threats, you'll get them one at a time in order. It takes 3 months for your next punishment tier to drop down *one* step. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/f/mNBeEEkI/d/p7scKW1K?comment=00050000000000000000

From your chat logs I see there was something you said that needed to be censored. That's a quick way to skip punishment tiers during a manual audit of your logs. As for what the *other* person did, they will be treated the same way you were; they will have to go through the punishment tiers and be evaluated with no liberties and leniency that you didn't get.

I suggest reading this material for more information on how you are expected to behave, and how reports work;

http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/reports-how-do-they-work

Let me know if you have any questions.

-DTN

•10 game chat restriction
•25 game chat restriction
•14 day account ban
•Permanent account ban

•10 game chat restriction
•25 game chat restriction
•14 day account ban
•30 day account ban
•3 Month ban with a warning for your next ban to be Permanent.
•Permanent account ban

I didn't even get a warning that I was on the verge of being Permanently banned. I've never seen a game go from 14 day ban too a permanent ban, It got me so off guard. Its weird, the game that I was banned from, I got the chat log saying "Thank you for helping the league community ect" then straight after that I got the ban.

Now that I know of these harsh punishments. If my account were to be unsuspended I could 100% agree too the terms and never to show any negativity towards another player. Hence since I know that my account would be on the verge of being permanently banned, in this case I didn't. it came by a surprise.

Also, I'm not saying I would because I'm not going too be making another account. I just want this one back..
However, You ban someone permanently for being negative to other players, they go into a rage make another account and then make it worse for other players that are new too the community because they are upset and frustrated over their ban. This to me seems like it has a negative effect! Its going to show newer players, hey this game is so toxic. I won't be playing this again type of situation and therefore making the community smaller than what it could be. That's just my thoughts though.

I would like an Admin to reply too me, telling me that I won't be getting my account unlocked. So I can stop waiting around, too accept it and move onto another game, Even though I love league. I care about this account and wont return without it. Thanks for your reply!

Riot will absolutely not undo a punishment unless it was done in error. With the hate speech present in these logs, it's impossible; they won't even consider it.

Of course, you don't need to take my word for it. Submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and ask them. It's unlikely that a Rioter will show up on your thread.

Whilst you seem incredibly negative and create toxic atmosphere for the game by fuelling the fire, I don't believe this should be a permanent ban. At the very least other people should take the initiative to simply mute you. I'd consider a chat ban as a cooling off period then a probationary period of where you can only send 5-10 messages per game once connected. 

This way you can still be strategic with your team but hopefully also get you into the habit of not becoming tilted or salty if you get into the habit of not being able to write as much. Then after the chat probation period you can be released with full chat allowances. 

It's like going to prison to become a better person instead of straight to death row but of course you'll still have a record for the rest of your life. At which point if you receive a certain amount of reports again you get banned for a certain period harsher then previous times but not permanently. 

It's rehabilitation! Which is also good for Riot as they will be seen never giving up on their player base but encouraging them to be better people rather than just the ban hammer.

That is all.

They do do this. The report system has 4 tiers of punishment and except in extreme cases such as death threats, hate speech etc, you go up them in order.

10 game chat restriction
25 game chat restriction
14 day ban
Perma ban

His behaviour is not bad enough to skip tiers, which means he has faced three punishments prior to this and not reformed his behaviour. It takes three months of good behaviour to go down a tier.

I don't know what to do from here.

You won't get unbanned no, the punishment was legitimate. You didn't receive the perma ban for increased severity of your behaviour, you received it because of the consistency.

Your best bet I'm afraid is to move on, and create a new account if you wish with a better understanding of your behaviour and how it affects others.

Riot doesn't seem to see it this way, which is why I confined it as a harsh punishment. I agree with you 100%, A permanent ban is basically a don't play the game punishment, though I've been playing for 3 years on that account nearly every day of the week. 

I agree that I was toxic, yeah maybe I fuelled the fire a little, but everyone has bad days...
  I would even pay to have this account back, sure I wasn't in a high tier, but the hours and money I've spent on gifting and buying skins is ridiculous..

Thank you for your comment, even though it may not make a difference.

Pointing out people feeding isn't verbal abuse. I want to say sorry right, but I far from am.
Whats funny is this is going back to another point where Riots condoning the troll behavior and allowing trolls to ruin and condemn people pointing out people feeding.

Giving someone advice is not punishment worthy. Telling them they are feeding when they already know and generally being toxic about it is. If Riot was condoning this sort of behaviour the OP wouldn't have gotten banned, and neither would have the many others who come to the boards with their chat logs to say they shouldn't have been.

Toxic behaviour is punishable in all forms. Just because someone got punished doesn't mean that the other guy didn't get punished too. Just because someone does something toxic, doesn't give us the right to do it.

Intentionally feeding is a reportable and punishable offence, having a bad game is not.

Telling someone to stop feeding (to who clearly are aware they are doing it) isn't toxic behaviour. 
The non existent toxicity shown by OP and getting banned has just proven you wrong in your argument (I want to say sorry, but honestly, i'm not).
There is pretty much this one guy (with a couple accounts trying to get them to answer) to argue it (which again, i'm not sorry to tell you since you clearly haven't been here long enough to notice).

If toxic behaviour was punishable, rito would do it. Yet, without fail. seem to give me toxic people non stop (who are also being reported) with no outcome (another instance where i've shut you down and am far from sorry on).

You honestly, can not say, that toxicity isn't being condoned with toxic players are getting skins and gifts from events from rito, yet as we are being shown from above, punishing innocent players. Like my first comment in this log, telling someone who's feeding to stop it ISN'T toxic behaviour.

Regardless of the intention, telling someone to stop feeding does not accomplish anyhting, and has negative connotations. It's like telling someone to "get good" or "stop hitting yourself". They don't want to feed, so telling them not to just adds to their frustration, and makes you sound like an ass.  It doesn't matter what the intention is, it matter how it comes across.

Telling someone to not feed implies that they're doing bad and should play a little more passive (which is seen in a number of games im having despite the trolls riot are throwing my way) and just farm for a bit instead of still giving away free kill (INTENTIONALLY FEEDING).
Farming and not dying isn't toxic behaviour or trolling. It's playing smart. Something that seems to be coming off as condemned. 

Get good: someones terrible and should learn to play
stop hitting yourself: someone forcing someone to hit themselves

"Get good" is the only relative(ish) thing to this topic. In this case, its is someone hitting himself without the comment of another player. 
If someone has made the comment after they've fed, the feeder is the one at fault, not the comment-er.

Then why not say "If you play a bit more passive you'll do better for now until we can support you" instead of "Stop feeding". If you sound like an ass to someone they're immediately going to dismiss everything you have to say. You are better off giving advice or not saying anything at all. Again, it matters how it comes across, not what the intention was.

Not grasping the dynamic of the games and limits of their champion does not = intentionally feeding. Intentionally feeding is INTENTIONAL. Playing smart isn't being condemned. Telling people in no polite terms that they are useless (which is what they hear when you say stop feeding) is not good behaviour, and comes under "Unsportsmanlike" if not under Verbal abuse depending on how the person has take in.

It's the feeders 'fault' for feeding sure, as much as an unintentional mistake can be, but it is the commenter's fault for being an ass about it.
